name: havenless
text: I think things were moving too quickly for Car 38

name: jdhenry105
text: A comment left by jdhenry105 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, ezcmac, lamboyster, BigNVeiny, glorify, DiamondMonster, GeyserShitdick, mortshire, snoozebar, lk, aHatOfPig, Zem, dropkickpikachu, Dainbramage, Zinggy)

name: twohundredninety
text: You can upload your own images as avatars. Just click the "edit view" link on the right, under "My Profile," and then the "edit" link under your avatar.

name: straw
text: It's ok man, I got a damn llama.  What more, someone else has this same damn llama.

name: nessotron
text: A comment left by nessotron was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Unright, TheSheezie, Crowpaw, Methadone)

name: sncether
text:
Chubby for your comment...as paired with your avatar.

I'm sorry to jerk you around like this.

name: rowboat
text: Whoa! This answers so many questions I'd been struggling with as to why there are so many clone avatars on this board! Especially the whole llama situation. There are, like, four of those. I didn't even know that you could let it choose one for you. Let alone why you would allow it to.

name: baryonyx
text: Yeah, the repetitive avatars are a nuisance...I used to identify people purely by avatar and all the people with generic ones would run together. It's best to personalize. It adds credibility to your posts, too; shows you care, y'know?

name: achilleselbow
text: Holy crap, I just realized you have a RIOT avatar!!! I've been seeing your comments throughout the whole archive, and to be honest there were times where I kind of thought you were a dick, but now I feel I was mistaken. Rock on.

name: rowboat
text:
Well, I guess we're gonna have to sort some things out. See, you called me a douche once, and I didn't take it too well. I then left some comments which may or may not amuse you.

I guess what I'm saying is that you may want to hold off on the peace process until you read them.

But yeah, RIOT rocks.

name: mugi
text: If I may make a confession...when I see your avatar, I see a Bichon Frise.  And I can't unsee it.

name: rowboat
text: That's understandable. But this Bichon Frise will tear you and your city down. Remember that.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
...and they grew to be the best of friends.

Or at least post concurrently a lot on the newer strips without any visible ill will.

name: rowboat
text: We even "Facebook!"

name: zem
text: seriously?

name: straw
text: It's ok.  At this point I have so many comments referring to the llama or have other people referring to the same llama.  After all this time, it's... it's grown on me.  God damnit, I love my damn llama!

name: chrissketch
text:
Everytime I see that avatar, the little talk-show host inside my head announces, "Ladies and gentlemen, RRRROOOODD HHHUUUUUGGINNNNS!"

Its a very good thing, this feeling.

name: theryuujin
text: I was assigned this avatar.   I love it much more than I did when I started.

name: spanntastic
text: I can hear the scanners in my head when I read this. Car 38? Are you there?

name: suprememongoose
text: This strip reminds me of my friend's one legged chain-smoking grandma. She sat near a window overlooking the highway and listened to the police scanner at maximum volume all day long .

name: helmstreet
text: my friend's dad slept with a police scanner on full volume so that he wouldn't wake himself with his snoring. It was a pretty fucked up scene.

name: spinynorman
text: What the fuck? My dad did the same thing, but not for snoring. He just had it on as he slept.

name: charchar
text: My grandfather is a retired fireman and he has one.  I think it's supposed to soothe him like a ticking clock for puppies.

name: sncether
text: I just can't sleep without a glass of warm milk and a meth lab raid.

name: aliiis
text: A comment left by aliiis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by apricotta, jezebel, Zem)

name: helmstreet
text: I think he may have boned it once or twice as well, but I couldn't be sure.

name: zapatos
text: Did they get mad rutty?

name: steev_dayv
text: He rocked its can.

name: tinhand
text: I would love to have a police scanner. How do you get them?

name: suprememongoose
text: The aforementioned grandma had several lying around that we later sold - it appears they can be obtained at RadioShack and probably at other places selling electronics. Hers looked like the model in the link, but they have even spendier ones it seems.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: link broke!

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Even  though the link is broken, it still gives us a splendid view of the current Radioshack slogan, which is, apparently "Do Stuff", which is just as good in my eyes.

name: zapatos
text: You wait until the officer begins to return to his car with your license, then you assault him and tear the scanner from his car.

name: rogergs
text: This is not what Richard Scarry told us policemen do all day.

name: rotating-dog
text: Its ok man. I never saw no worm driving an apple, either.

name: spinynorman
text: how does that motherfucker dress himself...

name: drskradley
text: I've never trusted that damned cat, myself.  He's up to something nefarious ALL THE TIME.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: Have you ever seen him and Lie-Bot in the same room, at the same time. Think about it...

name: owangutang

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Pat: Junk Mail.
Philippe: A Crummy Mess.

name: deovalente
text: I hope one day to get into law enforcement.  Now I also hope that when I get in, I meet a co-worker who is an Achewood fan.  We can re-create this very scenario and then tell our friends about it who won't understand unless they read Achewood.

name: jthm_guitarist
text: Oh man the alt text is the best part of an already awesome comic.

name: endoftheworld
text:
This takes me back. Ten years old, turning out all the lights, and watching the lights on the police scanner go back and forth until they got a signal.

Most of the time I couldn't understand what the hell they were saying, so I think my pre-adolescent brain just assumed they were all solving murders and major drug cases like on Dragnet.

Knowing my small town, it was probably just the usual routine drunk and disorderly at the many, many watering holes in provincial western PA. Also the occasional ambulance.

name: scion
text: Why is there such as avatar conversation? I would like to read about this comic; I will help with my own dullard's insights.

name: tekende
text: I don't know if what you're saying means anything.

name: genequagmire
text: Docking?

name: carlyle
text: Isn't the Fargo store the building Roark designed in the Fountainhead? Or... is Onstad just reffering to the actual Wells Fargo. (It is most likely the latter)
